mainArticle.title: UDPS and PPRD Divided Over Joseph Kabila’s Announcement to Return to DRC Through the Eastern Region
mainArticle.content: The announcement by honorary President Joseph Kabila to return to the DRC through the eastern region has, in recent days, become the center of controversy between the UDPS and the PPRD. In a statement received on Wednesday, April 9, by Radio Okapi, the secretary general of the ruling party, Augustin Kabuya, considers the decision of the former head of state to be an admission of his involvement with the AFC/M23 rebellion.
mainArticle.longContent: He claims he is not surprised by Joseph Kabila’s announcement, who, according to him, is Paul Kagame’s puppet. 'I ask our people to mobilize as one and unite behind Félix Tshisekedi, who embodies the values needed to save our country. Nangaa is Kabila’s product, and Kabila is Kagame’s product,' he said. He is surprised that Joseph Kabila spoke out only after sanctions were imposed on dignitaries of the Rwandan regime. On the PPRD side, these accusations are described as evasions. The deputy permanent secretary of the party, Ferdinand Kambere, denounced the attempts to undermine the moral authority of his party and other members. Ferdinand Kambere described Augustin Kabuya’s statements as pure lies meant to deceive public opinion: 'These are lies. Lacking any achievements to justify their record, they think they can keep fooling the people with lies to cover up their miserable failure.' In a letter addressed to *Jeune Afrique*, Joseph Kabila assured that 'after six years of absolute silence, one year in exile, and in view of the deteriorating security situation, he has taken the decision to return without delay' to the DRC in order to 'contribute to finding a solution.'
